title: "packages"
author: "Andy Field"
output: learnr::tutorial

```{r, eval = F, echo = F}
# Create bib file for R packages

tidylist <- c('tidyverse', 'dplyr', 'forcats', 'ggplot2', 'readr', 'tibble')
otherlist <- c('here')

here::here("inst/tutorials/discovr_05/packages.bib") |>
  knitr::write_bib(c(tidylist, otherlist), file = _)
```

In this tutorial all packages are pre-loaded. If working outside of the tutorial, load the [easystats]{.pkg} and [tidyverse]{.pkg} packages (and any others if you're using a concise style - see previous section) at the beginning of your `r quarto()` document:

```{r eval = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
```

This tutorial uses the following packages from [tidyverse]{.pkg}
 
- [dplyr]{.pkg} [@R-dplyr]
- [forcats]{.pkg} [@R-forcats]
- [ggplot2]{.pkg} [@R-ggplot2; @wickham_ggplot2_2016]
- [readr]{.pkg} [@R-readr]
- [tibble]{.pkg} [@R-tibble]
